turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Why not, Larry? We could get a positive confirmation that way.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Be reasonable, boys -- this isn't the time or the place to do some kind of half-assed autopsy on a fish. Ben...  do you have all the pictures you need?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: She's right.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Let's all get out of here, this place stinks.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I'm going home.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: He lost it on the way up.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: What kind of a shark did you say it was?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: We have got to close the beaches. We have got to get someone to kill the shark, we need non-corrosive mesh netting, we need scientific support... It's gonna cost money just to keep the nuts out and save what we have.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: I don't thing either of you is familiar with our problems...

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: You'd love to prove that. Getting your name in the National Geographic.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Larry, we can re-open the beaches in August.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: August! Tomorrow is the 4th of July, and we are going to open for business. It's going to be our best summer in years. If you're so concerned about the beaches, you two, you do whatever you have to to keep them safe, but with you or without you, the beaches stay open this weekend.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Got a pen on you?

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: There's only one thing you're good for anymore -- signing a damn voucher. Here. It's an authorization to employ a contractor.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: I don't know if I can do that without a...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I'm going to hire Quint to kill the fish. I want to see that shark dead.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Maybe we can save August...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Forget it. This summer's had it. Next summer's had it. You're the mayor of Shark City. You wanted to keep the beaches open. What happens when the town finds out about that?

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: I was acting in the town's best interests...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: The best interest in this town would be to see that fish belly-up in the water with a hole in his head. You do the right thing. You authorize me.  Right there. Whatever it costs.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: My kids were on that beach...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Just sign it, Larry.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: There's a fantail launch out there that won't make it beyond the breakwater.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You're tellin' me. I swear, this town has gone crazy.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Officer, I wonder if you could tell me where I could find Chief Brody?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Hooper, Matt Hooper. From the Oceanographic Institute.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: ...height and weight may only be estimated from partial remains. Torso severed in mid-thorax, eviscerated with no major organs remaining. May I have a drink of water? Right arm severed above the elbow with massive tissue loss from upper musculature. Portions of denuded bone remaining.  -- did you notify the coast guard?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: No, it was local jurisdiction.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Left arm, head, shoulders, sternum and portions of ribcage intact.  Please don't smoke. With minor post- mortem lacerations and abrasions. Bite marks indicate typical non-frenzy feeding pattern of large squali, possibly carchaninus lonimanus, or isurus glaucas. Gross tissue loss and post-mortem erosion of bite surfaces prevent detailed analysis; however, teeth and jaws of the attacking squali must be considered above average for these waters.  -- Did you go out in a boat and look around?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: No, we just checked the beach...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: It wasn't an 'accident,' it wasn't a boat propeller, or a coral reef, or Jack the Ripper. It was a shark. It was a shark.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Well, if one man can catch a fish in 50 days, then I guess 50 of these bozos can catch a fish in one day -- beginner's luck.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You did it! Did Ben Gardner catch this?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I didn't say this wasn't the shark, I just said I wasn't sure this was the one...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What d'ya mean?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: There are hundreds of different kinds of sharks; makos, blues, hammerheads, white-tips... any one of them could've attacked. Look -- shark digestion is slow. We could open this one up, and find whatever he's been eating is still inside.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Dynamite!  How was your day...?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Swell.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: We ought to let it breathe... Whatever.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Let's all have a drink.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Drowning. Lemme ask you something. Is it true most attacks take place in three feet of water, around 10 feet from the beach?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Yeah. Like the kid on your beach. I wish I could've examined that shark they caught...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Something else. Do most attacks go unreported?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: About half of them. A lot of 'missing swimmers' are really shark victims.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: There's a kind of a lone shark, called, uh...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Rogue?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Yeah. Rogue. Picks out an area where there's food and hangs out there as long as the food supply lasts?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: It's called Territoriality. It's a theory.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: And before 1900, when people first starting swimming for recreation, before public bathing and resorts, there were very few shark attacks, cause sharks didn't know what they were missing?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: You could say that.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: ...And it was Dartmouth Winter weekend, and she was Homecoming Queen, and I was her date; then she got into the fact that her family had more money than my family, and she was right -- her great-grandfather was in mining, and my ancestors were Yankee shipbuilders. So we broke up and I went home with some beatnik from Sarah Lawrence.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What stinks so bad?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Our friend, the shark.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Half a flounder. Hmmm... a burlap bag... a paint can... aha!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What? What?!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Just as I thought. He drifted up here with the Gulf Stream, from southern waters.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: How can you tell?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Florida license plate.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: He ate a car?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: No, but Tiger sharks are the garbage cans of the ocean. They eat anything. But this one didn't eat any people. There's nothing here...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: ...Nothing.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: If you're looking for a shark, you don't look on land. You go out and chum for him.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Chum?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Only one sure way to find him -- offer him a little something to eat. Chum -- blood, waste meat, fish, anything. They can sense it miles away. If he's out there, we might be able to get a closer look at him.  It's a good time, too. They're night feeders...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What is all this stuff?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Depth-finder, fathometer, sonar, closed-circuit TV -- fore and aft -- RDF, single side band...  And two loose nuts behind the wheel.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Can you tell from that if a big man- eater is around?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Sometimes.  Look here -- something big, probably a school of mackerel clumped together. And staying right with us.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Where'd you get all this?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I Bought it.  Both sets of grandparents set up trust funds for me; stocks went up, so I don't have to touch my principal.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You're at the Institute full time? Or do you have a job?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: It is a job. I'm not fooling around like some amateur. It's my life!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: We gotta get back soon...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I want to check something. Hold my feet.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Don't they have lifejackets or something? An extra boat?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: They must've hit something.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: He didn't have a dinghy aboard. I'm going down to take a look at his hull.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Why don't we just tow it in?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: We will. There's something I've got to find out.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Be careful, for chrissake.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: A White! A Great White, I found a tooth buried in the hull. He must've attacked... I knew it... Gardner's dead in there. I didn't see the mate...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: No shark did that to a boat!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: There is a kind of shark called a Great White Shark that every expert in the world agrees is a maneater.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: You're situation here suggests that a Great White has staked out a claim in the waters around Amity Island, and that he will continue to feed here as long as there is food in the water.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: There's no limits to where he can strike, and we've had three attacks and two deaths in the past few days. It happened like this before, in 1916, when a Great White killed five swimmers at Jones Beach, in Long Island.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: A shark's attack is stimulated by the kind of splashing and activity that occurs whenever humans go swimming -- you can't avoid it!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: A 4th of July beach is like ringing a dinner bell, for Chrissake!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I just pulled a shark tooth the size of a shot glass out of the hull of a wrecked boat out there.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: We towed Ben Gardner's boat in, Larry; he was dead and his boat was all chewed up.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I'm familiar with the fact that you are going to ignore this thing until it swims up and bites you on the ass! There are only two ways to solve this thing: you can kill it, or you can cut off its food supply...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: That means closing the beaches.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Wait a minute! I need you.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Out there is a Perfect Engine, an Eating Machine that is a miracle of evolution -- it swims and eats and that's all. Look at that! Those proportions are correct.  I know sharks.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I hope we get some more help.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I wish it would rain...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: This has got to be one big violation...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: This is quite a place.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What's that, a ship?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: You were on the Indianapolis? In '45? Jesus...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What the hell?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: It's a whale out there.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Don't shoot him any more! He's crazy on his own blood already!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I can't stand here doing nothing!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Quint...?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: No...  You think we can get back with those?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What day is this?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Wednesday... No, it's Tuesday, I think.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Think the tide's with us?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Just keep kicking.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Y'know, I used to hate the water...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I can't imagine why.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Christine what?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Worthingsly... Worthington -- no one ever died on me before.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You picked her up on the ferry.

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: I didn't know her.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: And nobody else saw her in the water?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Somebody could've -- I was sort of passed out.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Think she might've run out on you?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Oh, no, sir. I've never had a woman do that. I'm sure she drowned.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You from around here?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: No. Cambridge. Harvard. My family's in Tuxedo, New York, though.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You here for the summer?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: Some friends and me took a house.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What d'you pay for a place just for the summer?

turns.speaker: CASSIDY
turns.text: A thousand apiece, something like that. There's five of us. And we each kick in a hundred a week for beer and cleaning, stuff like that.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Pretty stiff.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Where'd you hide the 'Beach Closed' signs?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: We never had any. What's the problem?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Polly told me to tell you there's a scout troop in Avril Bay doing the mile swim for their Merit Badges. I couldn't call them in, there's no phone out there.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Get out of there  take these back to the office and make up some 'Beach Closed' signs, and let Polly do the printing.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: What's the matter with my printing?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: ...So then Denherder and Charlie sat there trying to catch their breath, and figuring out how to explain to Charlie's wife what happened to her freezer full of meat.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: That wasn't funny.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Mrs. Kintner must've put her ad in Field and Stream.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Looks more like the readers of the National Enquirer.

turns.speaker: MEADOWS
turns.text: We're not even sure what it was.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What else could've done that?

turns.speaker: MEADOWS
turns.text: ...and Bill Mayhew almost caught him in his net...?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Doctor, you're the one who told me what it was!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Look, I've got to talk to her. This isn't a contest we want the whole country entering.

turns.speaker: MEADOWS
turns.text: I agree. If she's going to advertise, I wouldn't recommend out-of-town papers. Amity people could take care of this.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I'm responsible for public safety around here...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I'd like to tell you what we're doing so far. These are some of the steps I've taken as Chief of Police...

turns.speaker: MEADOWS
turns.text: What's going on with the beaches, Chief?

turns.speaker: DENHERDER
turns.text: You wanna call it a night after here?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's only two-thirty. What, are you tired?

turns.speaker: DENHERDER
turns.text: Yeah, Charlie, I got my second wind three nibbles back.

turns.speaker: DENHERDER
turns.text: Leg of lamb this time?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Screw lamb -- let's shoot the sirloin!

turns.speaker: DENHERDER
turns.text: We're blowin' half the bounty on bait --

turns.speaker: DENHERDER
turns.text: One more after this, then I'm going home.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Set?

turns.speaker: DENHERDER
turns.text: You do this all the time, right, Charlie?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Twenty years.

turns.speaker: DENHERDER
turns.text: I can't believe that people pay money to go fishing. This is really dumb. This isn't even relaxing... it's just boring.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Look at him take it!

turns.speaker: DENHERDER
turns.text: Do I set the goddam hook?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Let him do it! Go-go-go-go-go!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Hi. I'm Matt Hooper. If your husband is here, I'd like to talk to him.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: So would I. Come on in.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Would you like something? Some coffee?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Is anyone having this...?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: My husband tells me you're in sharks.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I wouldn't put it that way. But I love sharks.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You love sharks?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I do.  But you've still got a problem here, there's a shark just off the island somewhere.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Here's to your husband, the only other rational man on the island. Day after tomorrow, I'll be gone, and he'll be the only one.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You're leaving?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Going out on the 'Aurora.'

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Is that a boat?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Is it! The best-funded research expedition to ever study the shark... around the world in 18 months.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Like those Cousteau specials on television? I think it's for the kids, but I love them.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Better than Cousteau, or Compagno with computers, telemetry, Defense Department funding...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I saw a show with sea otters, and a big turtle... Mikey loved it. Made me promise to get him one. Will you live on the boat?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Martin hates boats. Hates the water. On the ferry to the mainland, he sits in the car the whole way over. He's got this childhood thing, there's a clinical word for it.

turns.speaker: ELLEN'S VOICE
turns.text: ...push this? Oh. It's working. Hello, Martin?

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: This is Quint, Missus.

turns.speaker: ELLEN'S VOICE
turns.text: I just wanted to know if you were all right... the Coast Guard let me use their radio. Is Chief Brody there?

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: He's busy.

turns.speaker: ELLEN'S VOICE
turns.text: Well... is everything all right?

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Just fine, Missus. We'll be back soon. Everything's fine. We haven't seen anything yet. Orca out.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: What have you got there, Lenny?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: We had a shark attack at South Chop this morning, Mayor. Fatal. Gotta batten down the beach.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Who've you told this to, Lenny?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: I just found out about it -- but there's a bunch of Boy Scouts in the water a coupla miles down the coast from where we found the girl. Avril Bay, thereabouts. Chief went to dry them off.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Take my car, okay?  You come with us, Lenny.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: I've got all these signs here...

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: C'mon, it'll give us time to think about what they're going to say.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I've been to sea since I was 12. I've crewed three Trans-pacs --

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Transplants?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: -- and an America's Cup Trials...

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: I'm not talking about day sailing or pleasure boating. I'm talking about working for a living. Sharking.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: And I'm not talking about hooking some poor dogfish or sand shark. I'm talking about a Great White.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Are you now. I know about porkers in the water --  Here. Tie me a sheepshank.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I don't need to pass basic seamanship.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Let me see your hands...

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Ha. City hands. You been counting money. If you had a $5000 net and $2000 worth of fish in it, and along comes Mr. White, and makes it look like a kiddy scissors class has gone to work on it and made paper dolls. If you'd ever worked for a living, you'd know what that means.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Look, I don't need to hear any of this working class hero crap. Some party boat skipper who's killed a few sharks...

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Hey, Squirt! You want to stow this gear or you want me to use it for ballast? It ain't good for much but bait.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I'll see ya. Tell Dorothy hello.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Hello, Junior. What are you? Some kind of half-assed astronaut?  Jesus Christ, when I was a kid, every little squirt wanted to be a harpooner or a sword fisherman. What d'ya have there -- a portable shower?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Anti-Shark cage.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Who's inside, you or the shark?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: What's that supposed to prove?

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Just a little appetizer. I want our porker to know we're serving. I want to put some iron into that big yap...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Nothing. Nothing, nothing, nothing.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Hell, in the old days we went out with good charts, good sounding lead, and a damn good compass. Nowadays, these kids are afraid to go out without depth finders, radar, radio, electric toothbrush, every stupid thing...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Watch it! Compressed air -- you screw around with one of those and Boom! Careful, huh?

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Real fine stuff but it won't mean a thing to Mr. Whitey, of course... he didn't go to schools in electronics. He was born with what he does best. Eat. He's a swimming appetite. 'Course he might eat this stuff, but then I've seen him eat a rocking chair, too.  Next time, ask me.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: That's pilot whale, isn't it?

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: It ain't a Big Mac.  The expert don't approve. What do you thing? You're closer to the situation.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Hey, you! Farmer! Half-speed there...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Aye, Aye SIR. Stand by to repel boarders. Poop the mainsail. Argh, Jim Boy.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Gettin' ready to run again -- no? No?  What's he playin' here?  Put the gloves on!  Let's see who's gonna tease who now!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Let it go, don't waste your time.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Down here, Hooper!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I don't know what it is, but it's not a shark.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Look -- you may be a big Yahoo in the lab, but out here you're just supercargo, and you'll do as I say, or you can take your gear and backstroke home. Now get down here!

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: A marlin, or a stingray. Huh. Don't ever tell me my business again. Get back up on the bridge.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I'm okay...

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Fasten the pole.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Over there!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: What do you see?

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: At least you handle the boat all right. Stop. Here... Cut the engine.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: 20 feet, if it's an inch...

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: 25 feet. And three tons of him there.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Wire burn. Trying to stop a backstay from taking my head off.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Moray Eel. Bit right through a wet suit.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Face and head scars come from amateur amusements in the bar room. This love line here...  ...that's from some crazy Frenchie come after me with a knife. I caught him with a good right hand right in the snot locker and laid him amongst the sweetpeas.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Ever see one like this?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Bull shark scraped me while I was taking samples...

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Nothing! A pleasure scar. Look here --

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I'll drink to your leg.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: And I'll drink to yours.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: ...Mako. Fell out of the tail rope and onto the deck. You don't get bitten by one of those bastards but twice -- your first and your last.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I think I can top that, Mister...

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Don't tell me -- 'Death Before Dishonor.' 'Mother.' 'Semper Fi.' Uhhh... 'Don't Tread on Me.' C'mon -- what?

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: 'U.S.S Indianapolis.' 1944.

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Easy! It'll tear right out!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: The shaft is giving.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Coming right to us!

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: No -- comin' right at us! Slow ahead, he'll hit us head on --  Slower! Throttle back ---

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: He's heading under -- !

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: No way! He can't!

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: Follow him!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: He's under!

turns.speaker: QUINT
turns.text: What can that gun of yours do?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Power head with 20 ccs of strychnine nitrate. If I can hit him. I can kill him. But I gotta be close. Very close.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: That's disgusting! This is the largest, meanest, most vicious shark ever landed off Amity Island, and a known maneater!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Let's just cut him open and see what's inside...

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: I'm sorry, Martin. She's in a sick, terrible state.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Look, maybe this is the wrong time to pursue this, but I'm not sure...

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Is that tooth here? Did anyone see it?

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: I don't have it.

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: Carcaradon carcharias. A Great White.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Well, I'm not going to commit economic suicide on that flimsy evidence. We depend on the summer people for our lives, and if our beaches are closed, then we're all finished.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Sick vandalism! Brody, that's a deliberate mutilation of a public service message! I want those little paint-happy bastards caught and hung up by their baby Buster Browns!

turns.speaker: HOOPER
turns.text: That's it! I'm standing here arguing with a guy who can't wait to be a hot lunch. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER'S MOM
turns.text: Paul? Are you coming downstairs to eat?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER'S MOM
turns.text: You ran eight miles today, Puppy.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I'm not hungry, oddly.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER'S MOM
turns.text: But it's breakfast for supper. Your favorite, Paulie. I made French toast and sausage. Patties, not linkies, just like you like it.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER'S MOM
turns.text: Juno MacGuff called while you were out running. She wants to know if you're coming to her little coffeehouse performance on Saturday.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Thanks for the message.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER'S MOM
turns.text: You know how I feel about her.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: You've mentioned it about fifty times.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER'S MOM
turns.text: I just hope you don't consider her a close friend.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hey Bleek.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Hey, cool tiger. Looks proud.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, I swiped it from Ms. Rancick.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Your shorts are looking especially gold today.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: My mom uses color-safe bleach.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Go Carole.  So, guess what?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm pregnant.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: When I see them all running like that, with their things bouncing around in their shorts, I always picture them naked, even if I don't want to. I have intrusive thoughts all the time.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I'm supposed to be running.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: So, what do you think we should do?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I thought I might, you know, nip it in the bud before it gets worse. Because I heard in health class that pregnancy often results in an infant.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Yeah, typically. That's what happens when our moms and teachers get pregnant.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: So that's cool with you, then?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Yeah, wizard, I guess. I mean do what you think is right.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm real sorry I had sex with you. I know it wasn't your idea.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Whose idea was it?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'll see you at school, O.K.?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well! Nothing like experimenting.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I did the prep questions for this lab last night. You can copy my answers if you need to.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh, I couldn't copy your work.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: But you copy my work every week.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh yeah. I'm kind of a deadbeat lab partner, huh?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I don't mind. You definitely bring something to the table.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Charisma?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Or something.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Hey Juno... A couple of us are going to the cineplex after school to donut that movie with the guy with eighteen kids.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Sorry, Bleek... Going for my ultrasound. Gotta note and everything.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Okay, cool.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'll try to drop by later.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I just wanted to come over. You know, say hi. I miss hanging out with you on school nights.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I miss it too.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: So, it looks like you're getting pregnant-er these days.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah. Um, I hooked up a whole private adoption thing. These married people in Saint Cloud are going to be the parents.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Really? What are they like?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The guy is super cool! His name is Mark and he's into old horror movies and he plays guitar. I actually hung out with him today.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Is that normal?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I asked my dad and Bren not to narc us out to your folks, so we should be safe.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Oh. That's a relief.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm going to really start looking like a dork soon. Will you still think I'm cute if I'm huge?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I always think you're cute. I think you're beautiful.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Jesus, Bleek.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Well, I do.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Hey Junebug, when all this is over we should get the band back together again.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah. Sure. Once Tino gets a new drumhead we should be good to go.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: We could get back together too.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Were we together?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Well, we were once. You know, that time.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What about Katrina De Voort? You could go out with Katrina De Voort.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I don't like Katrina.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I totally heard you did.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I don't. Katrina smells like soup. Her whole house smells of soup.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Are you honestly and truly going to prom with Katrina De Voort?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Um, hi?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Leah just told me you were going with her.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Yeah, I did ask her if she wanted to go. A bunch of us from the team are going to Benihana, then the prom, then Vijay's parents' cabin.
